No, you can make it clear out all .debs with "sudo apt-get clean" or only out of date ones with "sudo apt-get autoclean"

from "man apt-get" :  Like clean, autoclean clears out the local repository of retrieved package files. The difference is that it only removes package files that can no longer be downloaded, and are largely useless.
